image.altText: A large windmill in a country town

props.synopsis: The family, including three children under 12, have been taken to hospital as a precaution after jumping from the moving caravan.

title.children: Five people jump from moving caravan after it was stolen in north Queensland

image.altText: Two colourful pills sit on a display.

props.synopsis: A single combined pill could ease the "tablet burden" for people who take multiple medications a day, researchers say.

title.children: The same 3D printing tech used to make car parts and teeth moulds could help ease the 'tablet burden'

image.altText: A fire inside a Brisbane City garbage truck

props.synopsis: There's been a surge in potentially deadly "hot loads" where batteries or flammables spark an explosion inside garbage trucks.

title.children: Garbage fires force trucks to dump flaming loads of rubbish onto suburban Brisbane streets

image.altText: A woman in a floral head scarf looks out over the water at a Gold Coast beach.

props.synopsis: Royal Life Saving's latest national drowning report shows one in four people who drown are born overseas. A migrant water safety program helped Omnia beat her fear and avoid being a victim.

title.children: Crippling fear used to stop Omnia going to the beach, now she wants her son to start surfing

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police allege they arrived to find a man alone at the home, armed with a knife and making threats.

title.children: Man taken to hospital after hours-long police negotiation on Queensland's Fraser Coast

image.altText: Drivers caught with seatbelt under their arm

props.synopsis: The Transport Department and minister have said neither review is ready to be made public, despite one being completed two years ago.

title.children: Qld traffic camera privacy reviews to be made public by opposition amid growing concerns

image.altText: Untitled design (4)

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are using tax time to spread misinformation about the Australian Taxation Office, including the claim "tax is voluntary" and the authority is "not a legal entity".

title.children: Sovereign citizens warned off using 'hopelessly flawed' logic during tax time

image.altText: A graphic of marketing through email and social media.

props.synopsis: Ads are getting harder to track and regulate online, making it easier for advertisers to sell unregulated and potentially harmful therapeutic goods.

title.children: Young Australians being 'bombarded' by 'manipulative' dark marketing campaigns

image.altText: A composite image of two soldiers, soldiers firing a have weapon, and a brain scan

props.synopsis: Doctors suspect mysterious brain injuries in soldiers repeatedly exposed to blasts and explosions could be the cause of memory loss, headaches, fits of rage and an increased suicide risk.

title.children: Some soldiers with brain injuries never saw combat. Now scientists think they know why

image.altText: A female mine worker walks past a mine dump truck at a coal mine in central Queensland.

props.synopsis: Workers are being asked to undergo blood tests as part of the recruitment process, particularly in the mining and resources sectors, with no guarantee their health information is secure, a new report has found.

title.children: 'No blood, no job': The companies ruling out job applicants who refuse to take blood tests

image.altText: Man working from home in a creative field on his ipad

props.synopsis: New laws come into effect next week that give workers the right to ignore work communications after hours, but they may not be enough to shift Australians' habit of working long hours.

title.children: Australians will soon have the right to switch off after hours — but it might not shift our 'excessive' work culture

props.synopsis: In Australia, there are more than twice as many children as childcare places, according to a world-first study analysing childcare access down to the street level in nine developed countries.

title.children: Australia’s childcare divide is growing. Here are the suburbs getting left behind

image.altText: Matthew Richardson of Australia displays his silver medal on an Olympic podium

props.synopsis: Australian cycling has been dealt a massive blow, with dual Olympic silver medallist Matthew Richardson to switch nationalities and compete for Great Britain at international events.

title.children: Aussie silver medallist announces switch to Team GB

image.altText: Warragamba Dam reached capacity on Saturday May 11 and began spilling on Sunday 12 for the second time this year

props.synopsis: Perfluorinated chemicals (PFAS), considered unsafe in drinking water by the US, have been detected at water filtration plants across Sydney.

title.children: What the 'forever chemicals' found in platypuses mean for the people of NSW

image.altText: A boy with scabs on his face

props.synopsis: Sewage seeping through the streets of Gaza is prompting a new infectious threat to desperate Palestinians.

title.children: 'We've never seen anything like this': Doctors baffled by skin infections spreading through Gaza

image.altText: A muscular fisher shows the strain as she hauls in a large fish on a line from the back deck of her fishing boat

props.synopsis: Bruce Davey went to the Gulf of Carpentaria in 1974 seeking adventure and seafood. Decades later, he's still there with his wife Juanita and their family — and they wouldn't have it any other way.

title.children: Couple celebrates '90 years' fishing remote Aussie waters in a job they still love today

image.altText: Journalist Masha Gessen standing in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: Russian-American journalist Masha Gessen has had their visa to enter Australia granted after an earlier delay. They were convicted in Russia of trumped-up charges of spreading false information.

title.children: Journalist and Putin critic Masha Gessen free to enter Australia after visa delay

image.altText: A reflection of people walking past the ASX indicator board.

props.synopsis: Two weeks ago, fear that global finance was on the eve of destruction caused a wave of panic as traders from New York to Tokyo battled one another in a race to exit financial markets. Now it's but a distant memory.

title.children: What did we learn from this month's stock market crash? Nothing

image.altText: Larry Emdur on the red carpet holding up his gold Logie award

props.synopsis: With a streaming title sweeping the awards to a convoluted voting process, the 2024 Logies shows how Australian TV is struggling to keep up with a rapidly changing industry.

title.children: The Logies proved that the one-time cultural heartbeat of Australia is facing arrest

image.altText: Joe biden seen against a black background looking serious

props.synopsis: A report by US House of Representatives Republicans alleges without evidence that the US President has enriched himself and members of his family through foreign business dealings.

title.children: Joe Biden alleged to have profited from influence-peddling scheme since 2014

image.altText: Adam Bandt in Mural Hall

props.synopsis: The Greens leader has raised concerns about a bill to force the CFMEU into administration, warning there were "no safeguards" to stop a future Coalition government from appointing Tony Abbott to take charge. Follow live.

title.children: 'No safeguards': Bandt claims Tony Abbott could be put in charge of CFMEU

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The federal government has offered political staffers the maximum pay rise allowed by law, along with new travel allowances, leave for cultural activities and extra pay for staff who speak multiple languages.

title.children: Parliamentary staff poised for pay rise with new cultural leave and travel allowances

image.altText: A photo of Santa Fe High School

props.synopsis: Family of the shooting victims had accused Antonios Pagourtzis and Rose Kosmetatos of being negligent by allowing their son, Dimitrios, to obtain weapons from their home and for not warning school officials or police about his deteriorating mental state.

title.children: US jury finds school shooter's parents not liable for violence

image.altText: Oprah Winfrey, left, holds hands with Phil Donahuek right, as he blows her a kiss

props.synopsis: The success of his show paved the way for other daytime talk-show hosts, most notably Oprah Winfrey, whose program eventually eclipsed Donahue's in the ratings.

title.children: Phil Donahue, pioneer of the daytime talk show, dies aged 88

image.altText: A graphic icon which says 'ndis'.

props.synopsis: With an impending vote on an NDIS overhaul, the federal government reveals it has left the door open for an NDIS "needs assessment" to be paid by participants, which disability groups say could cost hundreds or thousands of dollars.

title.children: NDIS participants could be made to pay cost of mandatory 'needs' test, in an eleventh-hour revelation

image.altText: An elderly couple sitting together.

props.synopsis: The federal government's star rating system for aged care facilities was supposed to provide transparency, but a former compliance officer says the ratings aren't telling the whole story about the state of aged care.

title.children: Five-star ratings are being awarded to aged care facilities that are non-compliant with government standards

image.altText: Harry and Meghan wearing sunglasses and smiling and clapping while standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: Some commentators have suggested stripping Harry and Meghan of their royal titles to avoid being seen as royal emissaries. But is the House of Montecito really such a threat?

title.children: Harry and Meghan's 'quasi-royal tour' puts King Charles in a tricky spot

image.altText: a woman with brown hair and glasses with a pile of textbooks and a laptop in front of her

props.synopsis: The mature age physiotherapy student is battling what's known as "placement poverty".

title.children: These students have to do 1000 hours of unpaid work but the bills don't stop piling up

image.altText: Michael Lynch smiling and wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Mike Lynch is among six people missing after a superyacht carrying 22 people capsized and sank off the coast of Sicily due to bad weather.

title.children: 'British Bill Gates' Mike Lynch among those missing after superyacht sinks in storm off Sicily

image.altText: Oprah Winfrey, left, holds hands with Phil Donahuek right, as he blows her a kiss

props.synopsis: The success of his show paved the way for other daytime talk-show hosts, most notably Oprah Winfrey, whose program eventually eclipsed Donahue's in the ratings.

title.children: Phil Donahue, pioneer of the daytime talk show, dies aged 88

image.altText: The actor Natalie Morris, a woman in her late 20s with brown/blonde wavy hair, staring seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: Beloved Australian series Bump will air its final season at the end of the year. But with screenwriting credits and a new film released, breakout star Nathalie Morris is just getting started.

title.children: Star of Bump takes on powerful new film role

image.altText: A woman holds a white pen while reviewing a document bound in a leather case.

props.synopsis: We should be reviewing our wills and estate plans every two to three years, estates lawyer Gillian Hunter says.

title.children: How often should you review your will?

image.altText: The Sturgeon moon rises over the Galata Tower in Istanbul, Turkiye.

props.synopsis: From country to country, keen sky gazers have diligently captured the first supermoon of the year.

title.children: Rare 'blue' sturgeon supermoon lights up global landmarks
